block.p: An opinionated guide to cultural and recreational goings-on in and around Westchester and Putnam Counties this week. Items may be submitted by mail, at least three weeks in advance, to Westchester Cultural Calendar, North Salem, N.Y. 10560.
THEATER

CROTON FALLS -- ''Summer Shorts,'' festival of short plays by members of the Schoolhouse playwrights workshop. Friday and Saturday at 8 p.m. and next Sunday at 4 p.m. Tickets: $10. The Schoolhouse, Owens Road, off Route 22. (914) 277-8477.

An opinionated guide to cultural and recreational goings-on in and around Westchester and Putnam Counties this week. Items may be submitted by mail, at least three weeks in advance, to Westchester Cultural Calendar, North Salem, N.Y. 10560.
THEATER

CROTON FALLS -- ''Summer Shorts,'' festival of short plays by members of the Schoolhouse playwrights workshop. Friday and Saturday at 8 p.m. and next Sunday at 4 p.m. Tickets: $10. The Schoolhouse, Owens Road, off Route 22. (914) 277-8477.

ELMSFORD -- The musical ''Sound of Music.'' Wednesdays through Saturdays at 8 p.m., with dinner at 6 and Sundays at 7 p.m. with dinner at 5. Matinees Wednesdays and Thursdays at 1 p.m., with lunch at 11:30 a.m. and Sundays at 1:30 p.m., with lunch at noon. Tickets: $46 to $66, with discounts available at select performances for students, people 62 and older and children. Through September. Westchester Broadway Theater. (914) 592-2222.

GARRISON -- Hudson Valley Shakespeare Festival performs ''Measure for Measure.'' Tonight at 6, Wednesday and Thursday at 7 p.m. and next Friday and Saturday at 8 p.m. Through July 30. Tickets: $19 to $30, with discounts available (except Saturday evenings) for students, people 65 and older and children. (Friday's performance with wine tasting presented by Millbrook Vineyards from 6 to 7 p.m. Tickets: $35.) Picnicking encouraged before shows. (Picnic dinners available by reservation. Cost: $16 and $18.) Boscobel Restoration, 1601 Route 9D. (845) 265-9575.

NEW ROCHELLE -- ''Shakespeare on the Sound,'' Fleetwood Stage presenting ''Comedy of Errors.'' Thursday through next Sunday at 8 p.m. Through July 30. Free admission. Picnicking encouraged, with sale of sandwiches, salads and beverages. Waterfront lawn of Wildcliff Stage, 44 Wildcliff Drive. (914) 654-8533.

NYACK -- The musical ''Mame,'' starring Carol Lawrence. Today at 2 p.m., Tuesday at 5 p.m., Wednesday at 2 and 8 p.m., Thursday through next Saturday at 8 p.m. and next Sunday at 2 and 7 p.m. Tickets: $25 to $42.50. Helen Hayes Performing Arts Center, 117 Main Street. (845) 358-6333.
MUSIC AND DANCE
CROTON-ON-HUDSON -- Bluegrass by the band American Flyer. Next Saturday at 7:30 p.m. Free. Croton Free Library, 171 Cleveland Drive. (914) 271-6612.

CROTON-ON-HUDSON -- WHUD-FM Radio's summer fest, starring Art Garfunkel; with Edwin McCain, the band Stryke 5 and Sasha. Next Sunday from noon to 7:30 p.m. Tickets: $20; parking, $5. Sale of refreshments and T-shirts. Free shuttle bus from Croton Harmon train station. Croton Point Park. (845) 838-6890.
DOBBS FERRY -- Philharmonia Virtuosi String Quartet. Part of summer music series. Wednesday from 6:30 to 8 p.m. Free. Waterfront Park. (914) 631-1000.

KATONAH -- Caramoor international music festival continues with Peter Oundjian's quartet master class. Thursday at 4:30 p.m. Tickets: $15. Brentano String Quartet performing works by Bach, Mendelssohn, Webern and Bartok. Friday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $25. Orchestra of St. Luke's, with Pamela Frank, violinist, and Andrew Armstrong, pianist; Peter Oundjian, conductor. Works by Mozart, Martinu and Dvorak. Next Saturday at 8:30 p.m. Tickets: $15 to $55, including pre-concert entertainment with Slovak singers, musicians and dancers, beginning at 5:30. All-Mozart concert with Anton Kuerti, pianist; Mark Steinberg, violinist; Brentano String Quartet; Samuel Rhodes, violist; Melanie Feld, oboist; Igor Begelman, clarinetist; Dennis Godburn, bassoonist, and Joseph Anderer, horn player. Next Sunday from 4 to 6:15 p.m., with pre-concert talk at 3. Tickets: $25 and $35. Caramoor, Girdle Ridge Road. (914) 232-1252.

PAWLING -- Acoustic Alchemy with guest artist, Louise Taylor. Tonight at 8. Tickets: $25; members, $22.50. Concert by Greg Piccolo and Heavy Juice. Friday at 9 p.m. Tickets: $17.50; members, $15. Towne Crier Cafe, 130 Route 22. (845) 855-1300.

PEEKSKILL -- Jazz, big band swing, love ballads and popular standards by vocalist, Doug Ferone, and Ferony Show Band. Fridays at 7:30 p.m. No cover. Quarter Note Cafe, Welcher Avenue and Washington Street. (914) 737-3287.

RIVERDALE -- Bronx Arts Ensemble in a holiday salute to George M. Cohan by vocalists, Cathy Gale and Paul Aquino. Tuesday at 2 p.m. Free. Rockwood Drive Circle, Van Cortlandt Park, Broadway and Mosholu Avenue. (718) 601-7399.
SCARSDALE -- Westchester Band; Dr. Joseph Albright, conductor. Tuesday at 7:30 p.m. (Rain date, Wednesday.) Free. Scarsdale Pool, Mamaroneck Road. (914) 723-7171.

SOMERS -- Outdoor jazz concerts. Fridays from noon to 2 p.m. Through July 28. Free. Picnicking encouraged. (914) 232-9511. ''Tchaikovsky and Friends,'' sunset serenade performed by Philharmonia Virtuosi; Richard Kapp, music director. Next Saturday at 6 p.m., with gates open at 5 for picnicking. Tickets: $10; children 17 and younger, $3. (Note: parking is one-third mile from concert area.) (914) 693-5595. Lasdon Park, Arboretum and Veterans Memorial, Route 35.
VALHALLA -- Kensico Dam music fest. Tomorrow, with gates open at 5 p.m. for picnicking. Illumination display after concert. North end of Bronx River Parkway. (914) 242-7275.

TARRYTOWN -- Trumpeter and flugelhornist, Mark Morganelli, and his Jazz Forum All-Stars. Varying repertory, including songs by Cole Porter, Rodgers and Hart, Duke Ellington and Miles Davis. Fridays from 7:30 to 10 p.m. No cover. Sunset Cove Restaurant, Washington Irving Boat Club, 238 Green Street. (914) 366-7889.
TARRYTOWN -- El Ballet Folklorico de Chile performs South American music and dance. Next Sunday at 4 p.m. Tickets: $20. Music Hall, 13 Main Street. (914) 332-9372.

WHITE PLAINS -- White Plains Recreation Pops Band performs marches, show tunes, classical and pop music; Alfred A. Renino, director. Wednesday at 8 p.m. Free. Bring ground cover and picnic. Lawn of George Washington School. (Rain location, Highlands Middle School.) (914) 422-1336.
ART
BRIARCLIFF MANOR -- ''In the Garden,'' recent acrylics by Diane Klein. Through July 29. Images Art Gallery, 1157 Pleasantville Road. (914) 762-3000.

BRONXVILLE -- ''The Photographic Image -- A Roving Eye,'' Vintage prints by Louis Stettner and contemporary photographs by Robin Gneiting, Peter North, Lisa Sorensen and Luca Spallanzani and others. Through Sept. 8. Noel Fine Art, 80 Kraft Avenue. (914) 337-4050.

CHAPPAQUA -- ''From the Garden,'' floral images by Eleanor Wunderlich, Charles Augustus Smith, Margaret Robinson, Susan Parslow and others. Through July 22. ''Dialogues in the Garden; Figures in Cement,'' sculpture by Jo-Ann Brody. Through August. Chappaqua Library, 195 South Greeley Avenue. (914) 238-4779.
CROTON-ON-HUDSON -- ''Flora and Fauna,'' photography by Zelda Appleton and watercolors by Margaret Robinson. Through Aug. 12. Cornelia Cotton Gallery, 111 Grand Street. 271-6802.
HARRISON -- Exhibition of art by Charlotte Klein. Opening reception Wednesday from 7 to 8:30 p.m. Through July 28. Harrison Public Library, Bruce Avenue. (914) 835-0324.

KATONAH -- ''Summer Light,'' featuring works by James Beardsley, Carol Benisatto, Ruth Dombrow, Gene Dunscombe, Charles Robert Erler, June Ferrin, Walter Finlayson and others. Village Gallery of Katonah, 43 Katonah Avenue. (914) 767-0073.

NORTH SALEM -- ''Unbottled: New York's Water -- Conservation + Preservation + Inspiration,'' contemporary landscape issues in art and science: creation of the Croton reservoir system and its impact, animal protection, fly fishing and artists renderings. Wednesdays through Saturdays from noon to 4 p.m. Through July 22. Admission: $4; people 62 and older, $3; children, free. Lunch available by reservation: (914) 669-6777. Hammond Museum and Japanese Stroll Garden, top of Deveau Road, off June Road. (914) 669-5033.

TARRYTOWN -- Selections from the library's art collection. (Works on view may be borrowed from the library for a month with a Westchester library card.) ''Impressions,'' works by Barbara Greacen. Both open tomorrow. Through July 28. Warner Library, 121 North Broadway. (914) 631-7734.

YONKERS -- ''Open Air Sketching: 19th-Century American Landscape Drawings in the Albany Institute of History and Art''; touring the recently restored Glenview Mansion, ''Fun City: Celebrating the Life of Ralph Fasanella'' and (opening Friday) ''Boats on the Hudson: Navigating Through History,'' featuring maritime artifacts, paintings, historical documents, models, photographs and boats. Wednesdays through Sundays from noon to 5 p.m. and Fridays from 5 to 9 p.m. Admission: $4; people 62 and older and children, $3. Hudson River Museum, 511 Warburton Avenue. Tours of the ''Half Moon,'' replica of Henry Hudson's 1609 vessel. Next Saturday and Sunday from noon to 5 p.m. J.F.K. Marina, just below the museum. Tickets: $5, on sale at the museum. (914) 963-4550.
YONKERS -- Paintings and poems by Meg Lindsay. Through Aug. 16. Library of Sarah Lawrence College. (914) 337-0700.
LECTURES

ELMSFORD -- ''I Was a Disney Toon in 'Fantasia 2000,' '' by John Culhane, author of ''Fantasia 2000: Visions of Hope.'' The speaker discusses his being caricatured as Flying John in the ''Rhapsody in Blue'' segment of Disney's ''Fantasia 2000.'' Thursday at 7:30 p.m. Free. Greenburgh Public Library, 300 Tarrytown Road. (914) 993-1612.

LARCHMONT -- ''Roth IRA's'' by Julian Block, author of ''Julian Block's Tax Avoidance Secrets.'' Sponsored by Larchmont-Mamaroneck Continuing Education. Friday at 8:30 a.m. Cost: $25. Registration. Mamaroneck High School. (914) 698-9126.
NORTH SALEM -- Discussion of the Titicus Reservoir Watershed and the best and worst plants to cultivate in a ''wet'' garden. Next Saturday 1 p.m. Free. Hammond Museum, top of Deveau Road. 669-5033.
FILMS
PEEKSKILL -- ''Time Code.'' Thursday through next Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $9. Paramount Center, 1008 Brown Street. (914) 739-2333.

SUFFERN -- ''Hi-Lo Country,'' independent film. Presented by Finkelstein Memorial Library. Wednesday 8 p.m. Donation: $3; students and people 60 and older, $1. Cultural Arts Center, Rockland Community College. (845) 352-5700, ext. 243.
CHILDREN

BEDFORD -- Children 7 and older learn the history of sundials and make a pocket sundial to take home. Next Saturday at 2 p.m. Cost: $1 for materials. Registration. Westmoreland Sanctuary, 260 Chestnut Ridge Road. (914) 666-8448.

CROTON-ON-HUDSON -- Independence Day celebration of 1790. Tuesday, beginning with cannon fire at noon; followed by reading of Declaration of Independence, continuing military re-enactments, ''Punch Van Winkle,'' puppet show at 1 and 3 p.m., children's games and festive hats workshop and parade with costumed citizens of the manor at 2 p.m. Admission: $8; people 60 and older, $7; children 5 through 17, $4; younger children, free. Picnicking encouraged; refreshments available. Van Cortlandt Manor, off Route 9. (914) 271-8981.

CROTON-ON-HUDSON -- Nature and survival skills program for students entering fourth-through-sixth grades. Participants learn tracking, arrow making and shelter building. Weekdays, beginning July 10, from 10 a.m. to 2 p.m. First of six weekly sessions. Through Aug. 18. Cost: $150 weekly. Registration. Croton Point Nature Center. (914) 242-6327.

GARRISON -- All-American picnic, with reading of Declaration of Independence, entertainment, foods, hikes and decoration of children's bicycles and tricycles, followed by mini-parade. Today from 11:30 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. Rain or shine. Admission: $20; children 4 through 13, $8. Reservations. (845) 265-3638. Picnic with performance of ''Measure for Measure'' at 6 p.m. Admission: $45; children 13 and younger, $22. Reservations. (845) 265-3638. Boscobel Restoration, 1601 Route 9D.
LARCHMONT -- Fourth of July picnic and races. Open to Larchmont residents only. Tuesday at 10 a.m. Free. Flint Park. (914) 834-0525.

MOUNT VERNON -- Independence Day celebration, featuring music, speeches, reading of the Declaration of Independence, bell tolling and refreshments. Tuesday at 10 a.m. Costumed demonstration of ''Pells Point: The Battle that Saved Washington's Army'' and children's activities. Wednesday from 12:15 to 1 p.m. Both free. St. Paul's Church National Historic Site, 897 South Columbus Avenue. (914) 667-4116.
OSSINING -- Workshop for parent and child age 1 through 3. Thursdays at 10:30 a.m. Through July 27. Registration. Ossining Public Library, 53 Croton Avenue. (914) 941-2416.

OSSINING -- Family scavenger hunt. Parents and children hunt for various items on a list containing hints like ''something an insect eats.'' Next Saturday from 10 to 11:30 a.m. Cost: $8; members, $6. Registration. Teatown Lake Reservation, 1600 Spring Valley Road. (914) 762-2912.

RYE -- Clay program for first througheighth graders. Weekly sessions, beginning July 10 from 10 a.m. to noon. Through Aug. 18. Cost: $165 weekly; members, $148. Registration. Rye Arts Center, 51 Milton Road. (914) 967-0700.
SLEEPY HOLLOW -- ''If I Had a Magic Wand,'' magic and illusion show by Jim Snack. Thursday at 7 p.m. Tickets: $3; children, free. Hudson Valley Writers Center, 300 Riverside Drive. (914) 332-5953.

SPRING VALLEY -- Songs and dances from around the world, presented by Anna Teigen. Program for children 4 through 7. Thursday from 7:15 to 8:15 p.m. Free. Finkelstein Memorial Library, 24 Chestnut Street. (914) 352-5700.

SOMERS -- Afternoon of old-fashioned toys and games. Today from noon to 3 p.m. ''4-H Summer Fair.'' Next Saturday and Sunday from noon to 4 p.m. Both free. Young and teenage farmers' program for third-through-ninth graders. Children can care for animals and work on the farm. Weekdays, beginning July 10, from 9 a.m. to 3 p.m. First of six weekly sessions. Through Aug. 18. Cost: $250 weekly. Registration. (914) 242-6327. Muscoot Farm, Route 100.

TARRYTOWN -- Celebrate Independence Day of 1855 in 19th-century style with pie-judging contest, town ball game, children's lawn games, performances of slack-rope walker and juggler, speeches, period music and country dancing with live music. Tuesday from 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Admission: $8; people 60 and older, $7; children 5 through 17, $4. Picnicking encouraged; refreshments available. Sunnyside, off Route 9. (914) 591-8763.

WESTCHESTER -- Summer ecology program for children in kindergarten through sixth grades at: Marshlands Conservancy in Rye, Cranberry Lake Preserve in North White Plains, Trailside Nature Museum at Ward Pound Ridge Reservation in Cross River and Lenoir Preserve in Yonkers. Weekdays, beginning July 10, from 10 a.m. to 2 p.m. First of six one-week sessions. Through Aug. 18. Cost: $150 weekly. Registration. (914) 242-6327.

WESTCHESTER -- Historic Hudson Valley's summer day camp for children 9 through 12. At three locations, on rotating basis. Philipsburg Manor in Sleepy Hollow, Sunnyside in Tarrytown and Van Cortlandt Manor in Croton-on-Hudson. Hands-on learning experiences from the 18th and 19th centuries, including gardening, weaving, milling, fishing, sketching and cooking and medicine and textile workshops. Weekdays, beginning July 10, from 9:30 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. First of five weeks. Cost: $190; multiple weeks, $175; members of Historic Hudson Valley, $165. Registration. 631-8200, ext. 628.
WHITE PLAINS -- ''Tigger Movie,'' for children 3 and older and their families. Wednesday at 7 p.m. Free. White Plains Public Library, 100 Martine Avenue. (914) 422-1476.

WHITE PLAINS -- Summer history program for second-through-sixth graders. Children learn to sew and bake and take part in Colonial crafts and games. Weekdays, beginning July 10, from 10 a.m. to 2 p.m. First of six weekly sessions. Cost: $150 weekly. Registration. Washington's Headquarters Museum. (914) 242-6327.

YONKERS -- First of two-part puppet- making workshop for children 8 and older. Next Saturday and July 15 at 2 p.m. Cost: $10 for materials. Registration. Philipse Manor Hall, Warburton Avenue and Dock Street. (914) 965-4027.
POTPOURRI

BEDFORD -- Outdoor sky program, with everyone getting this month's star map and learning how to read it. Tonight at 9. Canceled if cloudy. Free. Bring flashlight. Westmoreland Sanctuary, 260 Chestnut Ridge Road. (914) 666-8448.

BREWSTER -- Brewster's downtown music festival, with live music, food, children's activities and farmers market. Next Saturday from 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. Free. Town of Southeast gold lot; off Main Street, between Southeast Museum and Brewster Public Library. 279-1014.

GARRISON -- Self-guided hikes at Manitoga, home of Russel Wright. Weekdays from 9 a.m. to 4 p.m. and weekends from 10 a.m. to 6 p.m. Donation: $4. Route 9D, two miles south of Route 403. (845) 424-3812.

KATONAH -- Tours of Caramoor's house museum, during international music festival. Wednesdays through Fridays and Sundays from 1 to 4 p.m., with last tour at 3 and Saturdays from 1 to 5 p.m., with last tour at 4. Admission: $6; children 16 and younger, free. (914) 232-5035. Tours followed by afternoon teas. Thursdays and Fridays at 1:30 p.m. Tickets: $22. Reservations. 232-5035, ext. 221. Al fresco lunch and tour of Caramoor's gardens. Tuesdays at noon. Tickets: $25. Reservations. (914) 232-1253. Girdle Ridge Road, off Route 22.
MOUNT VERNON -- Church bell tower tour. Fridays at 3 p.m., weather permitting. Free. St. Paul's Church National Historic Site, 897 South Columbus Avenue. (914) 667-4116.

OSSINING -- Guided tours of two-acre Wildflower Island, home to hundreds of native and endangered species of wildflowers. Saturdays at 10 a.m. Admission: $3; members of Teatown, $2; Friends of Wildflower Island, free. Children 13 years and younger not permitted on the island. Reservations. Teatown Lake Reservation, 1600 Spring Valley Road. (914) 762-2912.
RYE -- Fireworks display. Tomorrow, Wednesday and Friday at 9:15 p.m. Parking: $4. Fireworks display. Tuesday at 9:15 p.m. Parking: $7. Playland Park. (914) 925-2700.

SLEEPY HOLLOW -- Fiction-writing workshop led by David Surface. Designed for writers at all levels. First of four sessions. Next Saturday from 10:30 a.m. to 12:30 p.m. Through July 29. Cost: $130; members, $110. Registration. Hudson Valley Writers Center, 300 Riverside Drive. (914) 332-5953.

SOUTH SALEM -- ''Antiques in the Church Yard,'' with 110 dealers exhibiting toys, furniture, kitchen collectibles, doorstops, fireplace tools, china, carpets and other items. Tuesday from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. Rain or shine. Admission: $5, with all-you-can-eat pancake breakfast, $10. Steven's Memorial United Methodist Church, Route 123 and Shady Lane. Exit 6 of I-684 or Exit 38 of Merritt Parkway. (914) 273-4667.
TARRYTOWN -- Tours of Lyndhurst. Tuesdays through Sundays and holiday Mondays from 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. 635 South Broadway. (914) 631-4481.
